page.title: 01Vernham Dean Civil Parish
page.content: The area is a sparsely populated rural area of outstanding beauty situated in the north-west corner of Hampshire two miles from the Berkshire border, with a small portion in Wiltshire. The area comprises parts of the parishes of Vernham Dean, Hurstbourne Tarrant, Tangley and Chute but includes only part of the village of Upton and approximately twenty other scattered dwellings. The people are mainly employed in agriculture or work in the nearby towns. The area is served by a daily bus service to Andover 8 miles distant and is convenient to the M3 and the M4 for access to Swindon, Reading, Southampton, Salisbury, London or the West. A railway line linking Exeter and London passes through Andover.
